summary: This is an email chain between US Attorney's Office (SDNY) prosecutors discussing sending a 'friendly subpoena' to an attorney (M) to obtain a copy of a settlement agreement between a victim (Jane Doe) and Jeffrey Epstein from a 2009 civil suit. The agreement is sought for the ongoing investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell's participation in abuse.

persons.name: Audrey
persons.context: A prosecutor in the email chain indicates that Audrey needs to approve the subpoena before it is sent.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The investigation is into Maxwell's participation in the abuse of Jane Doe, and the settlement agreement is relevant to this investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The 2009 civil suit and resulting settlement agreement was between Jane Doe and Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jane Doe
persons.context: The individual who filed the 2009 civil suit against Jeffrey Epstein, which was resolved by the settlement agreement being sought.

connections.description: Jane Doe was the plaintiff in a 2009 civil suit against Jeffrey Epstein, which was resolved by a settlement agreement.
The document states the investigation is into Maxwell's participation in the abuse of Jane Doe, linking her to Epstein's alleged crimes.
Attorney M possesses the settlement agreement from Jane Doe's civil case, suggesting a prior or ongoing legal representation.
M is cooperating with the SDNY investigation by being willing to provide the settlement agreement upon receipt of a subpoena.

events.title: Civil suit filed by Jane Doe
events.description: Jane Doe filed a civil suit against Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Settlement agreement executed
events.description: The civil suit between Jane Doe and Jeffrey Epstein was resolved with a settlement agreement.

events.title: Discussion of friendly subpoena
events.description: SDNY prosecutors email about sending a 'friendly subpoena' to attorney M to obtain the 2009 settlement agreement for the Ghislaine Maxwell investigation.

keyFacts: A 2009 civil suit settlement agreement between a victim (Jane Doe) and Jeffrey Epstein is a key document sought by prosecutors in the Ghislaine Maxwell investigation.
An attorney (M) in Florida possesses the settlement agreement and is willing to provide it to the SDNY if served with a subpoena.
The Maxwell defense team is involved in the process, as the email references the 'Maxwell team' wanting to send the 'friendly subpoena'.
The settlement agreement is considered relevant to proving Maxwell's participation in the abuse of Jane Doe.
The email chain shows internal prosecutorial discussions about legal strategy, including considerations of protective orders and how to phrase the subpoena rider.
